title: Navigating the electoralContestation Package
text: sample data repository avoid needing download, recode, etc local machine. needs updating, data build data 2025 MPSA meeting yet include newer BYU CES data
code: library(electoralContestation) library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tidybayes) electoral_contestation %>% head() ## # A tibble: 6 × 116 ##   black white latino asian american_indian   age married female college faminc ##   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> ## 1     0     1      0     0               0    61       1      1       1      0 ## 2     0     1      0     0               0    41       1      1       1      1 ## 3     0     0      0     0               1    25       0      0       1      0 ## 4     0     1      0     0               0    76       0      1       1      0 ## 5     0     1      0     0               0    63       0      0       0      0 ## 6     0     1      0     0               0    72       1      1       0      1 ## # ℹ 106 more variables: survey_weight <dbl>, county_fips <dbl>, CD <dbl>, ## #   LD <dbl>, zipcode <dbl>, caseID <dbl>, state <chr>, year <dbl>, ## #   survey <chr>, prepost <chr>, presvote_trump_2020 <dbl>, voted2020 <dbl>, ## #   most_important_problem <chr>, attend_march <dbl>, criticize_election <dbl>, ## #   burn_flag <dbl>, recount <dbl>, court <dbl>, certify <dbl>, concede <dbl>, ## #   state_certify <dbl>, violent <dbl>, new_election <dbl>, stolen_2020 <dbl>, ## #   free_fair <dbl>, voteconfidence <dbl>, auth_1 <dbl>, auth_2 <dbl>, …

title: Navigating the electoralContestation Package
text: package meant help analytic workflow. ’ve organized functions thematically: modeling: three main modeling functions, brms.ordinal, brms.linear brms.nominal. used estimate ordinal, linear nominal models, respectively. IV variable independent variable, DV variable dependent variable. IV variable specified formula, higher order interactions can easily specified. Thus far, ’ve implemented brms.ordinal function, can modify one needs ’ll update others. prediction: two main prediction functions, posterior_means posterior_pme. posterior_means function generates posterior predictions two-way interactions, posterior_pme function generates posterior predictions marginal effects. functions used generate predictions models estimated previous step. plotting: two main plotting functions, ggPoint ggMargins. ggPoint function generates point estimate plot rug plot dependent variable distribution, ggMargins function generates marginal effects plot rug plot dependent variable distribution. functions used visualize predictions genera

title: Replication package to accompany
text: now well acknowledged American political landscape now polarized, divided, fractured point since US Civil War. political parties grown ideologically extreme homogeneous. heart democratic politics implied trust process institutions elections administered. Yet, relatively little known support (opposition) behaviors meant challenge legitimacy American elections, call “electoral contestation.” E 𝚎𝚕𝚎𝚌𝚝𝚘𝚛𝚊𝚕𝙲𝚘𝚗𝚝𝚎𝚜𝚝𝚊𝚝𝚒𝚘𝚗\texttt{electoralContestation} package collection data, code, documentation accompanies book, “Electoral Contestation Erosion Democracy.” package designed comprehensive resource interested study electoral contestation.

title: ggMargins_categorical — ggMargins_categories
text: Generate plot point estimates BRMS object function generates `ggplot2` plot posterior point estimates credible intervals `brms` model, specifically designed cumulative categorical outcomes. data come 2020 Western States Survey.

title: ggMargins_categorical — ggMargins_categories
code: ggMargins_categories(   data = plot_dat,   size_x = 10,   size_title = 12,   title = "Marginal Effect",   ytitle = "Change in Probability",   ylimits = c(-0.25, 0.25),   mvar = "presvote_trump_2020",   point_size = 3,   point_opacity = 0.5,   bar_opacity = 0.5,   point_color_values = c("#E63946", "#457B9D"),   point_distance = 0.5,   ... )

title: ggMargins_categorical — ggMargins_categories
text: data Dataframe containing posterior predictions, typically `electoralContestation::posterior_me` similar prediction functions. must include columns named `.category` (response categories), `mean`, `lower`, `upper` (credible intervals), column specified `mvar` (moderator variable). Defaults `plot_dat`. size_x Numeric value. controls font size axis text. Defaults `10`. size_title Numeric value. Font size plot title axis titles. Defaults `12`. title Character string. Main title plot. Defaults `"Marginal Effect"`. ytitle Character string. Label Y-axis (becomes X-axis `coord_flip()`). Defaults `"Change Probability Pre Post"`. ylimits Numeric vector length 2. Lower upper limits Y-axis (becomes X-axis `coord_flip()`). Defaults `c(-0.25, 0.25)`. mvar Character string. Name moderator variable column `data` dataframe, used grouping coloring points. Defaults `"presvote_trump_2020"`. point_size Numeric. Size data points `geom_point()`. Defaults `3`. point_opacity Numeric. Transparency (alpha) data points. Defaults `0.5`. bar_opacity Numeric. Transparency (alpha) error bars. Defaults `0.5`. point_color_values Character vector. Colors used levels moderator variable (`mvar`). Defaults `c("#E63946", "#457B9D")`. point_distance Numeric. Dodge width `geom_point()` `geom_errorbar()` horizontally separate points error bars different groups categorical axis. Defaults `0.5`. ... Additional arguments passed `ggplot2::theme()` customization plot elements.

title: ggPoint_categorical — ggPoint_categories
text: Generate Point Estimates Plot Categorical/Ordinal Dependent Variables function creates `ggplot2` visualization point estimates credible intervals, typically representing "winner/loser" effects, combined rug plot showing raw distribution dependent variable faceted column. designed ordinal nominbal dependent variables.

title: ggPoint_categorical — ggPoint_categories
code: ggPoint_categories(   plot_dat,   raw_data_for_rug,   dv_col_name = "burn_flag",   facet_col_name = "presvote_trump_2020",   color_col_name = "prepost",   category_levels = c("1", "2", "3", "4", "5"),   category_labels = c("Strongly Disagree", "Disagree", "Neither Agree nor Disagree",     "Agree", "Strongly Agree"),   facet_levels = c("0", "1"),   facet_labels = c("Trump Voter", "Biden Voter"),   color_levels = c("pre", "post"),   color_values = c("grey", "black"),   color_labels = c("Pre-Survey", "Post-Survey"),   point_size = 3,   dodge_width = 0.6,   linerange_width = 1.25,   title = "Point estimates",   y_axis_title = "Posterior Mean Estimate",   x_axis_title = "",   rug_jitter_height = 0.1,   rug_side = "b",   rug_alpha = 0.1,   rug_size = 0.3,   rug_length = grid::unit(0.05, "npc"),   rug_color = "lightgrey",   y_axis_limits = c(0, 1),   ... )

title: ggPoint_categorical — ggPoint_categories
text: plot_dat Dataframe containing posterior predictions `mean`, `lower`, `upper` bounds estimates, columns `.category`, `prepost`, faceting variable. raw_data_for_rug Dataframe containing original, raw data. used calculate distribution rug plot. must contain columns specified `dv_col_name` `facet_col_name`. plot shows marginal distributionals across pre-post treatment. dv_col_name Character string. name column `raw_data_for_rug` represents raw dependent variable (e.g., `"burn_flag"`). variable contain numeric factor levels (e.g., "1" "5") map `.category`. facet_col_name Character string. name column `plot_dat` `raw_data_for_rug` used faceting (e.g., `"presvote_trump_2020"`). color_col_name Character string. name column `plot_dat` used coloring points lines (e.g., `"prepost"`). category_levels Character vector. underlying levels `.category` variable (e.g., `c("1", "2", "3", "4", "5")`). Used factor reordering. category_labels Character vector. labels corresponding `category_levels` (e.g., `c("Strongly Disagree", ..., "Strongly Agree")`). facet_levels Character vector. underlying levels `facet_col_name` (e.g., `c("0", "1")`). Used factor reordering. facet_labels Character vector. labels corresponding `facet_levels` (e.g., `c("Trump Voter", "Biden Voter")`). color_levels Character vector. underlying levels `color_col_name` (e.g., `c("pre", "post")`). Used factor reordering. color_values Character vector. hexadecimal color codes levels `color_col_name` (e.g., `c("grey", "black")`). color_labels Character vector. labels corresponding `color_levels` (e.g., `c("Pre-Survey", "Post-Survey")`). point_size Numeric. Size `geom_point` markers. Defaults `3`. dodge_width Numeric. Horizontal dodging width `geom_point` `geom_linerange` separate overlaid groups. Defaults `0.6`. linerange_width Numeric. Line width `geom_linerange`. Defaults `1.25`. title Character string. Main title plot. Defaults `"Point estimates"`. y_axis_title Character string. Label Y-axis (becomes X-axis `coord_flip()`). Defaults `"Posterior Mean Estimate"`. x_axis_title Character string. Label X-axis (becomes Y-axis `coord_flip()`). Defaults `""` (empty string). rug_jitter_height Numeric. Amount vertical jitter rug plot points. Defaults `0.1`. rug_side Character string. Side rug plot (`"b"`, `"t"`, `"l"`, `"r"`). Defaults `"b"` (bottom, left `coord_flip()`). rug_alpha Numeric. Transparency (alpha) rug plot marks. Defaults `0.1`. rug_size Numeric. Size (thickness) rug plot marks. Defaults `0.3`. rug_length Unit object. Length rug plot marks. Defaults `unit(0.05, "npc")`. rug_color Character string. Color rug plot marks. Defaults `"lightgrey"`. ... Additional arguments passed `ggplot2::facet_wrap()`.

title: Generate Posterior Predictions with 2 way interactions — posterior_means
code: posterior_means(   model = burn_flag,   xvar = "presvote_trump_2020",   mvar = "prepost",   xval = seq(0, 1),   mval = c(0, 1) )

title: Generate Posterior Predictions with 2 way interactions — posterior_means
text: model brms model xvar independent variable mvar moderator variable xrange values xvar mrange values mvar

title: Generate Posterior Predictions with 2 way interactions — posterior_means

what: #' @title posterior_pme Generate Predictive Marginal Effect — posterior_pme
title: #' @title posterior_pme Generate Predictive Marginal Effect — posterior_pme
text: Use category_groups group categories together. function asks user choose group categories together, order aid interpretation many category models (e.g. ordinal multinomial models). function returns average marginal effect category, across levels xvar, variables observed.

title: #' @title posterior_pme Generate Predictive Marginal Effect — posterior_pme
code: posterior_pme(   model = burn_flag,   xvar = "prepost",   mvar = "presvote_trump_2020",   mrange = c(0, 1),   xrange = c("pre", "post") )

title: #' @title posterior_pme Generate Predictive Marginal Effect — posterior_pme

title: #' @title posterior_pme Generate Predictive Marginal Effect — posterior_pme
